creator: bugs.apache@starbase12.cjb.net
text:
Running Gentoo Linux, I cannot get Apache 2.0.49 compiled with LDAP support 
running. 

If compiled with LDAP enabled, Apache crashes at startup when calling the 
function apr_sockaddr_info_get(). 

Without enabling LDAP Apache runs normal. The machine is using IPv6 as well as 
IPv4. OpenLDAP 2.1.26 is installed, as well as Berkeley DB 4.1.25. 

A GBD trace ends up with:

	Program received signal SIGSEGV, Segmentation fault.
	[Switching to Thread 16384 (LWP 4301)]
	0x4042951c in memcpy () from /lib/libc.so.6


For more information please also see the Gentoo Bug #50989 at 
http://bugs.gentoo.org/show_bug.cgi?id=50989
Looks like a dupe of bug 29128
creator: corporate_gadfly@hotmail.com
jorton@redhat.com
text: *** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 29128 ***
